headline: Caldo de Res (Mexican Beef Soup)
description: Caldo de res is a Mexican beef soup made with beef bones, cabbage, potatoes, corn, chayote, and cilantro for a deliciously hearty and satisfying meal.
name: Caldo de Res (Mexican Beef Soup)
recipeIngredient: 2 ears corn, husked and cut into thirds
1 medium head cabbage, cored and cut into wedges

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the meat from the beef bones into about 1/2 inch pieces, leaving some on the bones.
Heat a heavy soup pot over medium-high heat until very hot. Add oil, tilting the pan to coat the bottom. Add meat and bones and season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until thoroughly browned.

Add onion and cook until lightly browned; stir in broth and tomatoes. The liquid should cover the bones by 1/2 inch. If not, add some water to compensate. Reduce heat to low; simmer with the lid on loosely until meat is tender, about 1 hour.

Pour in 4 cups water, and return to a simmer. Add carrots and 1/4 cup cilantro, and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in chayote, corn, and potato; simmer until vegetables are tender. Push cabbage wedges into soup; cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Ladle soup into large bowls, including some meat, vegetables, and bones. Garnish with cilantro, jalape√±os, and minced onion. Squeeze lime juice over soup and serve with radishes.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is the üí£.. made it like 4 tomes already and everyone wad in awe like WOW .. easy simple and extremely flavorful
Hearty! My family loved it
This is a staple in our house.
This was so good! My family loved it! I added Brussels sprouts.
I added the chayote at the end of the cooking and it gave such a great and unique taste. I will make this again soon
There's a local Mexican restaurant tat makes this on the weekend. Uses beef ribs and shanks. It is fantastic.
Nice and easy to make to eat. And came out great
Easy and delicious, YUMMY! Healthy too!

I‚Äôm a been a fan of Caldo de Res!!! This recipe is amazing and super simple to fallow and so worth making it!!! Full of Flavor!!! Can‚Äôt get over how good this turned out!!! My son approves!!! Going in for a second bowl!!!
Add cumin and bouillon cubes
Added sour cream to my garnish ‚ù§
I put some spices

This recipe was actually extremely easy and amazing, but I did do things a little different. 1. For the BEST and most tender meat, I used Zoup Bone Broth and no water (almost a gallon) and cut the boneless chuck into cubes and added to the broth. I allowed it to tenderize for 4 hours on a slow boil. 2. I added an 8oz can of tomato sauce and a tbsp of tomato paste. 3. I added about 3 tbsp cumin, 2 tbsp each of garlic and onion powder. I also added 4 tbsp of Knorr Beef Bouillon powder to taste. 4. I saut√©ed minced garlic and the onions for the soup with olive oil into the onions were a translucent yellow. 5. I let the soup slow boil with all veggies for an hour, and added about 3 celery stalks cut into 1/3rds. Overall, the soup was a HIT! So flavorful and my family loved it! Add some Mexican rice to it for an even heartier flavor!
Added some zucchini squash, used stew meat and beef bone stock. Wonderful!
Love this recipe, also the caldo de pollo. Either way, it‚Äôs soooo good when made right. Best in cold weather.
It was delish yummy
Great recipe easy to make good home feel on a cold day. I used ox tail, added cumin, curry, chulula for a kick.
Delicious.
Wonderful home style soup. MN minnesota should stick to taco bell (R)

Excelente! I used boneless beef ribs because that's what I had in the freezer. We added garlic with the onion, but otherwise, followed the ingredients exactly. We had never eaten chayote but love it after using it in this recipe. I pressure cooked the meat and then moved to the stove from the step of adding the carrots. The sliced fresh jalapenos and lime for serving is a must ! This soup is really wonderful and we will definitely make this again.

I substituted to chicken instead of the beef. The soup has lots of different nutrients and enjoyed to eat with garnish and Tajin spice! 
I enjoyed the Chayote squash first time with the soup. I will keep the recipe and cook again!
Delicious and hearty!! Whoever said not good because it‚Äôs a lot of work, if you can‚Äôt cook just say that. It was simple and tasted like it took all day.
it. was. amazing!!! first attempt and I agree you need a little garlic and some cumin. but goodness the broth!! it put me in a coma!!
Delicious everyone loved it ! I used also some other seasonings plus garlic and added yucca instead of chayote. Great recipe!
Recipe was easy and delicious, family loved it, perfect for the chilly day we had.

This soup hit the spot! Great recipe and easy to follow. The only thing I did different was add two crushed garlic cloves with the beef broth. I have a "meat and potato" man and 3 kids from age 13-1 year; each of them enjoyed it. The veggies are big enough that the kids could pick what veggies they want.

What a great recipe 5 stars only because I can't give more. I would highly recommend to read the whole recipe first to know what is for garnish and what is for the cooking but I was hella easy and super good
Simple recipe. Yes it take time to make this soup but one needs patience, but it is all worth it. Love it!

I always refer to this recipe, so I don‚Äôt forget anything. The best part of this recipe is you can add or subtract what ever you want. I add celery and cominos and a bit of garlic in the beginning. And if it‚Äôs ‚Äú bland‚Äù well taste it as you go and fix it, there‚Äôs plenty of time. The second day I‚Äôll add pasta elbows
Turned out wonderful!!! I cit try e veggies up into more bite size pieces!!
this was so good but i need a bigger pot to hold everything!.
I love it.!This is the first recipe i tried to do of caldo and we all loved it. Simple yet delicious.. Now i make it when we want something different than just other beef or chicken dishes.

I've tried this just as the recipe states.. Loved it, but I changed a few things.. I cut the meat into small pieces, I cube the potatoes and chop the carrots small, I use frozen corn with no cob. The one thing I noticed is my family had to take the soup out of the bowl, cut it up and put it back to eat it.. I thought that was a waste. I follow everything but cut everything small, further I use marjoram, garlic, green beans, and hot pepper as well as dice a couple very hot peppers into the soup. 
Absolutely wonderful.. Any vegetable in the fridge is fine actually !

great recipe with great directions! I could not find a beef shank, so just used stew meat (pandemic shopping is rough!) but it turned out great. my husband is from Mexico and he was very impressed! It does make a lot for sure! I did add some cumin and a little extra water. But otherwise, I followed the directions exactly and it was delicious.

Turned out super amazing. Only changes I made was in the vegetables. I used frozen yuka instead of the chayote and added calabaza squash. Boiled both for the last 20 minutes along with the rest of the vegetables.

It's still simmering but I've already tasted it and it is amazing! In the beginning of the recipe calls for vegetable oil 1 tablespoon I used to teaspoons of white truffle oil! I also threw in a few basil leaves and seasoned my meet with adobo by Goya, paprika, and a little bit of beef flavored bouillon by Goya as well. I also threw the packet of beef bouillon left over once I added more water to the soup as well as added Sazon Goya 1 packet to the soup! This is my go-to recipe for ever so simple easy to follow I love it!
The recipe is good cooked up some corn tortillas and added minced chipotle instead of the jalepano. Tasted awesome.

I love this recipe....I use 1lb beef shank and 2lbs beef oxtails (we like a lot of meat) and I add a 14oz pkg of roasted diced tomatoes with garlic and a teaspoon of minced garlic as well. I skip the jalape√±o and I like To add a teaspoon of cumin. 
I top it off w more cilantro, diced onion, and lime juice at the end in each bowl and I fry up a batch of corn cakes (fried cornbread that looks like a pancake) instead of tortillas....Delish!!

This has been my favorite soup growing up. I do add cumin approximately 2 t and squash if you wish. I also make some Mexican rice and add to the bowl and ladle the soup over it. Add a squeeze of lime and voila! It is delicious!

YUMMY!!! I‚Äôve made it twice and everyone loves it. Great recipe. My mom‚Äôs Mexican but I never learned how to make it while she was still alive, so, I was a little embarrassed to have to look up an actual recipe, but so glad I did! 
Thank you for a great recipe.
Did not include the radishes or the chayotes, but it turned out great! I like the heavy black pepper flavor - that could be tapered back a bit if needed.
I initially made this and the soup is very delicious. I have been making it again and again for my family.

Great recipe! I‚Äôve made this several times and tweaked it along the way.

Tweaks:
1. season beef with cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add minced garlic when you add the onions.
2. I also use Better than Bullion beef paste for extra flavor (and salt!) add some when browning the meet and add some to the broth while cooking. It makes a WORLD of difference in the heartiness of the broth!! Beef Bullion would work too.
3. Add one yellow squash and one zucchini.

My husband is Chicago, but comes from a huge Mexican family. He love this soup ! I have also tasted him mom‚Äôs version and I like this one just the same , I just didn‚Äôt use limes and jalape√±os on the side because he doesn‚Äôt like them ! Very tasty and added the veggies at different stages makes the whole dish tasty and different textures as you eat
Ate this at a restaurant. Had to learn how to make it. It is fabulous! Made the broth using bones for a rich flavor and refrigerated it. The next day added the squash and corn and served to guests.
I added cumin, oregano, garlic, and more beef broth than water. The soup came out excellent. Great flavor and tender meat.

Just made this soup today and it came out absolutely delicious! The only thing I left out was the can of tomatoes. I felt the tomatoes would take away flavor from the meat and broth. But other than that it turned out very good! ???? My boyfriend loved it! This soup is perfect for winter season to help you stay warm.
Loved it! I followed the recipe as is and it turned out fabulous!

Phenomenal Caldo. Used Better Than Bouillon Beef as stock, short ribs because my market did haven‚Äôt shank and reduced salt a tad bit. Seared then Simmered meat for 3 1/2 hours and it fell right off the bone. Family was impressed.
I make it all the time. I find it is much easier to cut the meat off the bone after it's been cooked. You need only add the veggies and spices you like and still get a great tasting soup!
Turned out delicious. I didn‚Äôt have beef stock, so I just used water. Didn‚Äôt have chayote, so I omitted. Still flavor was quite authentic.
Another winner! My best friend is from Veracruz and he said it was delicious. He is my number one taste tester and hard to please, so it must‚Äôve been a good recipe.

Great soup. I used shoulder instead. Keeping it cooking a little longer made the meat so tender. I also put yuca and calamari in it. For the wife. ‚Äò‚ÄòTwas a delight. Mix it up and put items you love in it and make it your own!
This soup was exceptionally flavorful and entirely satisfying. 10/10 will be making again!
Perfecto!!!!!
No changes yes
Very good, i make it as much as i can!
This was our first try at making Caldo de Reys. My family loved it! Made exactly as written.
This is my go to recipe. It‚Äôs the best!!
The flavor is great! I made it with everything except for the radishes as I'm not fond of them. Definately a keeper!
Followed recipe. Bland and on the sweet side, flavor didn't match the work.
I will add more meet. But it was delish!

I get excited when I think about making this soup! The first time I made it, everyone was floored by how delicious it was. The experience was truly memorable because we still talk about it! One of my favorites I can always rely on when I want to make a gathering something "special" because I know it's going to be another big HIT with my guests!

I made this 2 times now all summer my BF who hates veggies. Begged me to make this! He‚Äôs says I ate all the veggies so that tells u something ??. I have to make a lot big family.. So I double or triple ingredients I add way more. It is soooo good thank u!
Family Loved it.

First Caldo de Res of the cold season! I make this every year once or twice per year. It is a labor of love because it takes so long to prep. Especially when you are making it for 12-16 people! 

Regardless of how long it take, it‚Äôs well worth it because it tastes almost as good as my dad‚Äôs Caldo de Res! And he was a cook! A really amazing cook!
Great. I added 2 minced cloves of garlic.

I've saved this as a Favorite go-to recipe because it's very good and similar to the way I always make caldo de res. 
I use the beef shanks along with additional stew meat and brown both first before adding the onion and 4 cloves of garlic. I season the meat with Badia Sazon Completa. After adding tomatoes and broth, I add a teaspoon, or slightly more, of cumin, coriander, Mexican oregano, and Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning along with 2 bay leaves. When I add additional water, I put a few shakes of Knorr's powdered chicken bouillon and sometimes toward the end I add torn corn tortillas for flavor and thickening.
Really good soup. I added salt as I added ingredients to the pot and then and then added more salt at the end. This recipe is a keeper.
This recipe is absolutely perfect and will deliver a wonderfully hearty soup that will warm you up on cool days. it is very satisfying. I wouldn't change a thing!
This Dish is a Favorite it my house. I do add about 1 Tablespoon of Cumin which is enhances the authentic flavor ! Love this recipe!!!!
Followed the directions as listed. It was really good! My husband loves it too! I made this a few times already and will keep making it.
I made this for the first time and I had to use short ribs it was amazing!!!!!

I absolutely loved how easy this recipe was, and how maleable. If you don't want to take time cutting onions, you could put in salsa since you're adding tomatoes and peppers anyway. Also, SUPER delish with oxtail!

I'm a complete novice, but this came out perfect, especially the corn and cabbage!
We love this

I was going for the same flavor and consistency that our local restaurant serves on weekends. Ommitted corn and cabbage, but added sliced zucchini. WOW! The overall flavor and the texture of the meat is just as delicious if not even more so as the soup from the restaurant. Very easy to make too! Yum!!!
This Caldo is sooo delicious. The flavor is absolutely amazing! My husband loved it!

No matter where I went, no Caldo De Res was ever as good as my grandmother‚Äôs recipe, which was passed down to my mother and unto me to serve to my kiddos. That is, until I came across this little baby. How am I going to break the news? Guess I‚Äôll just have to make it all over again, invite mom over, and let her rate it herself. 

This one is definitely a winner!
This recipe is good. But I say NO to the pickled jalape√±os. Nope.
Turned out great. Do recommend keeping the potatoes in large pieces. Too small and they break down and get mushier over time.
This turned out well. But the chayote needs to be peeled. The skin is tough.

This was so delicious, I followed step by step. The only thing I did differently to give it more flavor was used all beef broth and I didn't add any water. I also added minced garlic while heating the onions. I also squeeze lime into it when serving. DELICIOUS!!
I followed the directions to a T and my husband loved it.

I loved this recipe! I did add cumin and ground red pepper and more broth for my personal preference and it was amazing! It seems like a lot of prep but it really isn‚Äôt. I couldn‚Äôt find a beef shank so I used a beef chuck tender roast. I am guessing it took me just as long to cut it down into the sizes I wanted as it would have cutting the meat off the shank. As for the rest, just a lot of chopping! Also, use fresh corn on the cob. I read reviews where they said it came out mushy. Fresh is the way to go!

I have made this recipe almost a dozen times since I first discovered it about 4 years ago. I rarely waiver on the ingredients unless I am adding more meat or decreasing quantities so to make a smaller batch. And yes, I do use chayote and add the radishes. Since I live in the Rio Grande Valley, chayote is pretty easy to obtain from my local HEB. I prefer the can Rotel Diced tomatoes (roasted, if available) with green chili's...a little extra heat adds to it. C
This was so delicious! I will be making this again :)

I added fresh chopped garlic, a little boullion, an extra potato, an extra carrot, and two extra ears of corn. Instead of a medium/small cabbage, I used a large cabbage. This recipe was incredibly hearty and tasty, but there was less broth than I would like, so I made a second smaller pot of just beef stock, cabbage, and onion and then added it to the original soup pot. In traditional caldo de res, you wouldnt normally use tomatoes, and while it did add some flavor, I felt that it didnt taste as authentic. I would also suggest chopping up one jalape√±o and adding it to the soup in the last ten minutes to give it a kick. 

This recipe fed six adults for three meals! I will be making it in the future, but with the amendments described above.
I‚Äôve made this recipe countless times. Absolutely WINNER! My husband is from Monterey Mexico and this Caldo De Res is comparable to his mothers. Perfect comfort food.

Great recipe. I have been making caldo ever since I lived in El Paso and discovered it--I ended up having it for lunch almost every day, with tortillas, served in a little restaurant across the street from where I worked. I used this recipe as a refresher because I had not made caldo for about a year and did not want to leave anything out. It's very, very good!

Great recipe. I have been making caldo ever since I lived in El Paso and discovered it--I ended up having it for lunch almost every day, with tortillas, served in a little restaurant across the street from where I worked. I used this recipe as a refresher because I had not made caldo for about a year and did not want to leave anything out. It's very, very good!

It is not that much work, but it does sit on the stove for a long time. I agree with others that garlic and cumin add a nice layer of flavors. Do not forget the lime for acidity! Not being much of a meat eater, I liked that the soup is predominantly vegetables. During the harvest it is easy to use all of the available vegetables from the garden. The only thing I needed from the store was the beef, beef stock, and the lime!
Winter go to for sure. I added more veggies & meat. Family fave
I left out the potato and radishes and added some mushrooms. My family and friends loved it.
I added extra meat and veggies, so glad I did! I garnished with an avocado slice and pico - served with fresh corn tortillas. It was a hit! Yes I will definitely make this again!
Really tasty, authentic caldo. I added green beans and mushrooms for personal taste and loved the flavor. Makes enough to share with a friend and still have plenty for myself. Thanks for the recipe

I thought it was a little bland even though I added cumin, garlic and A veggie spice blend with pepper flakes. To make it more Honduran, I added yucca and malanga. Overall it was good and I will make it again.
I will make it again. Tastes like my husbands Tia's. He loves it.
I made it exactly as written and it was great. Next time I will try substituting yucca for the potato just to change things up a bit.
